problem: Find the value of $x$ that satisfies $\frac{\sqrt{5x}}{\sqrt{3(x-1)}}=2$. Express your answer in simplest fractional form.
solution:
We begin by multiplying out the denominator and then  squaring both sides \begin{align*}
\frac{\sqrt{5x}}{\sqrt{3(x-1)}}&=2\\
(\sqrt{5x})^2 &=\left(2\sqrt{3(x-1)}\right)^2\\
5x &= 12(x-1)\\
12& =7x\\
x&=\boxed{\frac{12}{7}}.\\
\end{align*}Checking, we see that this value of $x$ satisfies the original equation, so it is not an extraneous solution.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Square both sides of the equation
$\left(\frac{\sqrt{5x}}{\sqrt{3(x-1)}}\right)^2=2^2$

## Step 2: Simplify the equation
$\frac{5x}{3(x-1)}=4$

## Step 3: Multiply both sides by $3(x-1)$
$5x = 12(x-1)$
## Step 4: Distribute 12 on the right side and move all x terms to one side
$5x = 12x - 12$

## Step 5: Subtract 5x from both sides
$0 = 7x - 12$

## Step 6: Subtract 12 from both sides
$-12 = 7x$

## Step 7: Divide both sides by 7
$-12/7 = x$
## Step 8: $x = -\frac{12}{7}$
## Step 9: Check the solution by plugging $x = -\frac{12}{7}$ into the original equation
$\frac{\sqrt{5\left(-\frac{12}{7}\right)}}{\sqrt{3\left(-\frac{12}{7}-1\right)}}=\frac{\sqrt{-\frac{60}{7}}}{\sqrt{-\frac{36}{7}}}=\frac{\sqrt{-60/7}}{\sqrt{-36/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{-60/7}}{\sqrt{-36/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{-60/7}}{\sqrt{-36/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{-12*5/7}}{\sqrt{-4*9/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{-12/7}*\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{-4/7}*\sqrt{9}}=\frac{\sqrt{-12/7}*\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{-4/7}*\sqrt{9}}=\frac{\sqrt{-12/7}*\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{-4/7}*\sqrt{9}}=\frac{\sqrt{-12/7}*\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{-4
$\frac{\sqrt{-12/7}*\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{-4/7}*\sqrt{9}}=\frac{\sqrt{(-12/7)}\sqrt{5}}{(\sqrt{(-4/7)}\sqrt{9})}=\frac{\sqrt{60/7}}{\sqrt{36/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{60/7}}{\sqrt{36/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{15}\sqrt{4}\sqrt{1/7}}{\sqrt{36/7}}=\frac{\sqrt{15*4*1/7}}{\sqrt{36/7}}=\frac{2\sqrt{15/7}}{6/\sqrt{7}}=\frac{2\sqrt{15/7}}{6/\sqrt{7}}\times\frac{\sqrt{7}}{\sqrt{7}}=\frac{2\sqrt{105}}{6}$
## Step 10: Simplify the equation
$\frac{2\sqrt{105}}{6}=\frac{\sqrt{105}}{3}$
## Step 11: Check the solution by plugging $x = -\frac{12}{7}$ into the original equation
$\frac{\sqrt{5\left(-\frac{12}{7}\right)}}{\sqrt{3\left(-\frac{12}{7}-1\right)}}=\frac{\sqrt{105}}{3}$
## Step 12: Check the solution by plugging $x = -\frac{12}{7}$ into the original equation
This is a Final Answer.
